Articles.Content:
I've had this game for a while, and attempted to play it on two previous occasions, but it was this third try where I broke through the "[snip] this game is awesome" barrier. I didn't realize at first that there was a quicksave option, which made things more stressful but not in a bad way, so I had a lot of fail and start all over experiences; but then I had a success. I made it to low Mun orbit and back to Kerbin (and I know this is just the beginning). It took me 3 real life hours and on re-entry my heart was pounding because I was coming in fast and I didn't know if my ship would make it, but it did. It was like scoring 10 goals in Rocket League at the same time.

So I just wanted to put a thank you out there to all the individuals responsible for creating such an awesome experience.

Edited October 5, 2020 by peteletroll
Redated by a moderator
Welcome to the forum  @Particle, and fly safe!

@Particle achieving your firsts in ksp is so exhilarating! Congrats! And welcome to the forum! As Scott Manley says: Fly Safe!
